definitions.definition: a short, quick attack by a military force, such as a small group of soldiers or an aircraft, made against an enemy position:
examples: A series of sorties was carried out at night by specially equipped aircraft.

definitions.definition: a short journey to somewhere you have not been before, often with a particular purpose:
examples: It was our first sortie into the shopping centre.
This is the acclaimed historian John Taylor's first sortie into fiction.
